newsitem.title: MALTA: Malta sets up task force on indebted drydocks.
newsitem.headline: Malta sets up task force on indebted drydocks.

text.p: Maltese Prime Minister Alfred Sant has set up a task force to draw up a strategy for the debt-ridden Malta Drydocks after a highly critical report issued last week, officials said on Tuesday.
The report, commissioned by Sant, said the state-owned yard expected a 12.5 million Maltese lira ($35 million) loss this year following a similar loss last year. Turnover dropped 31 percent in 1995.

The officials said the task force was set up after a meeting on Monday between Sant, Finance Minister Lino Spiteri, the drydocks council directly elected by the yard's 3,500 workers, and General Workers' Union representatives.
The task force will commission a Maltese expert to consider management structures within a month and evaluate the situation at the yard.
The yard has been reduced to taking on uneconomical repair contracts just to keep the workforce going, the report said.
